instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3435: What is 820-3435? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U1950: What is U1950? This chip often becomes corroded on pin 8 on the PP3V42_G3H pin causing PM_SLP_S4_L to go missing.
definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.ALL_SYS_PWRGD: What is ALL_SYS_PWRGD? ALL_SYS_PWRGD is present when PP1V8_S3, PP5V_S3, PP1V2_S3, PP1V05_S0, PP5V_S0, PP3V3_S0, & PP1V5_S0 are present and working. If any of these rails is not working, ALL_SYS_PWRGD will be pulled down and the machine will not turn on. .
definitions.ALL_SYS_PWRG: What is ALL_SYS_PWRG? This is a typo of ALL_SYS_PWRGD. When you see ALL_SYS_PWRG, assume they meant to type ALL_SYS_PWRGD.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
Hi everyone.

I have seen this fault before in models <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>.

The problem is the following, I don't have <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL>, when removing <CHIP>U1950</CHIP> the machine turns on but obviously not completely because <SIGNAL>PM_PCH_SYS_PWROK</SIGNAL> is missing.

My question is, how do I attack this bug? Would I have to change all the ICS involved in the <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRG</SIGNAL> line since some may be blocking the ignition?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL> comes high when <CHIP>U1950</CHIP> is removed?
Put it back and test again removing <TRANSISTOR>Q8150</TRANSISTOR>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
Yes, when removing <CHIP>U1950</CHIP> the <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL> voltage is 3.3 normal.

What would change by removing <TRANSISTOR>Q8150</TRANSISTOR>?

I replaced <CHIP>U1950</CHIP> and it's working normal, I'll have it tested.
